newsitem.title: ITALY: Autogrill moves into Greece, Austria.
newsitem.headline: Autogrill moves into Greece, Austria.

text.p: Italian roadside restaurant chain Autogrill SpA has embarked in Greece and Austria and its owner, the Benetton family's Edizione Holding, said it is interested in taking a "considerable stake" in Italy's soon to be privatised motorway operator Autostrade.
Autogrill chairman Gilberto Benetton, speaking at the inauguration of its first roadside restaurant in Greece on Friday, said "privatisations can be a great opportunity which we intend to seize."
Societa Autostrade SpA, owned by state industrial holding IRI, is due to be privatised by this summer.

Benetton said fast food catering in Greece had great potential for development and Autogrill "is ready to invest a sum not far off 20 billion lire in the next three years," with the aim of having 10 roadside restaurants in five years.

In Austria in recent days, Edizione's Schemaventidue, into which Autogrill SpA and Finanziaria Autogrill SpA will soon be merged, reached an accord with Wienerwald Restaurants Gmbw to acquire 14 motorway restaurants for around 50 billion lire.
The accord also includes a concession to build a motorway restaurant in Hungary.

Finanziaria Autogrill, the listed holding which controls Autogrill, posted 1996 operating profit of 87.5 billion lire against 74.8 billion in 1995 on turnover of 1.71 trillion against 1.61 trillion. Net consolidated profit for last year was 62.3 billion lire against 43.7 billion in 1995.
